column4: can anyone here help me change the menu icon next to the Applications area?
like Im using the gnome-human icon theme
just for one icon?

i dont know if i remember it exactly but if i am not wrong the name of the icon is something like gnome-desktop-icon or something like that. i think you can find it in /usr/share/gnome/ try finding it and replace it
ok here is the way
open gconf-editor
go to apps>panel>objects in gconf-editor
check the option "use custom icon" and select your icon
you have to find menu-object there
find menu-object and select the option "use custom icon" and select your own
let me check one minute
ok do this in terminal : locate distributor-logo
find the path to the logo of your theme. the one that you are using. and replace it there. you can use in terminal : sudo cp /path/to your logo.svg /path/to the logo in the theme.svg
i found mine in /home/snake/.icons/hydroxygen/22x22/places/distributor-logo.png
so try checking yours in .icons folder. and look carefully to your size. i dont know what size ar you using
if it has to be 24X24 than change that one
it worked for me in this way. i had the gnome foot before and i have the ubuntu logo now
i dont know that. maybe yes
sorry
sorry no
dont do it. i know you have to do some command to update the icons but i dont remember it
i am happy for you :)
i use the ubuntu logo. :)
yes. it seems a little more near to the menu
